intro: Panicum inops, commonly known as the slender panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. It produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are often overlooked due to their inconspicuous nature. Panicum inops plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environment.
